summary:
CORE COMPETENCY
Immunology I  Proteomics  I  GMP/ GLP I  Protein Engineering  I Molecular Biology (Molecular cloning, CRISPR/Cas9, Cytokine biology) I   Cell based assay development  I Reporter assays and ELISA I Fluorescence Polarization assay I Fluorescence Intensity assay I ITC, SPR, in vitro assays | Bioinformatics (Homology modelling, docking, drug design, network analysis, big data analysis, etc.)  I Science illustration

Ph.D. fellow  in Chemical Biology (2019-2023). I have work experience in industrial and academic setups. My expertise ranges from computational chemistry, biochemistry, cell biology and proteomics. I am a problem solver, critical thinker, and team player with attention to detail. My aspiration is to grow as a scientist, where I can learn new techniques and contribute towards innovative projects in a challenging environment. 

Milestones: 
* Part of the prestigious MSCA-ITN Ph.D. consortium (one of the 12 fellows from all across the globe)

* Member of The Royal Society of Chemistry, The U.K. (MRSC)

* Main contributor towards discovery and biological characterization of a new protease (Manuscript in preparation)

* Contributed towards the crystal structure of USP15-Mitoxantrone (PDB: 6GH9) 

* Contributed towards scientific regulatory documentation to establish SoeMac (made by Soe Health Ltd, U.K.) as a medical device in the U.K. (https://www.soemac.com/)

* Experienced as a GMP/ GLP Q.C.Analyst  for testing export quality products at Emami India Ltd. 

* Appreciated for being a good presenter, communicator, science illustrator and innovative. 

I am always happy to exchange ideas or discuss innovation. Please send me a connection request or email at pharma.rishov26@gmail.com

I am open to positions and am happy to relocate within the Netherlands. I have A2 level Dutch proficiency and am in the process of applying for a permanent residency in The Netherlands.

projects.title: Development of TRIM-specific assays suitable for High- Throughput- Screening
projects.description: Ubiquitination is a post-translational modification process that controls the degradation, signaling, and activity of many, if not all, cellular proteins. It is a cascade of enzymatic reactions. Recently, it has become a prominent pathway to find drug targets. Tripartite Motif (TRIM) proteins participate in ubiquitin and ubiquitin-like modifications and form a large family of over 70 RING-type ubiquitin in humans. Current researches and hypotheses indicate its role in cancer development, tumor progression, viral infection, and many other deleterious effects. My work is focused upon developing appropriate high-throughput assays for Tri-Partite Motif (TRIM) proteins. My work encompasses developing recombinant E2 and E3 proteins. Following this, the focus will be put on assay development and validation and assay translation for high throughput assays. This effort will also include the generation of assay reagents and/or synthetic peptide substrates by total synthesis.

projects.title: In-Plate Chemical Synthesis of Isopeptide-Linked SUMOylated Peptide Fluorescence Polarization Reagents for High-Throughput Screening of SENP Preferences
projects.description: Small ubiquitin-like modifiers (SUMOs) are conjugated to protein substrates in cells to regulate their function. The attachment of SUMO family members SUMO1-3 to substrate proteins is reversed by specific isopeptidases called SENPs (sentrin-specific protease). Whereas SENPs are SUMO-isoform or linkage type specific, comprehensive analysis is missing. Furthermore, the underlying mechanism of SENP linkage specificity remains unclear. We present a high-throughput synthesis of 83 isopeptide-linked SUMO-based fluorescence polarization reagents to study enzyme preferences. The assay reagents were synthesized via a native chemical ligation-desulfurization protocol between 11-mer peptides containing a γ-thiolysine and a SUMO3 thioester. Subsequently, five recombinantly expressed SENPs were screened using these assay reagents to reveal their deconjugation activity and substrate preferences. In general, we observed that SENP1 is the most active and nonselective SENP while SENP6 and SENP7 show the least activity. Furthermore, SENPs differentially process peptides derived from SUMO1-3, who form a minimalistic representation of diSUMO chains. To validate our findings, five distinct isopeptide-linked diSUMO chains were chemically synthesized and proteolysis was monitored using a gel-based read-out.

projects.title: Interaction of 7SK RNA with human Dicer and Gag- In collaboration with McGill University, Canada
projects.description: 7SK is an abundant small nuclear RNA found in metazoans. It plays a role in regulating transcription by controlling the positive transcription elongation factor P-TEFb. 7SK is found in a small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex (snRNP) with a number of other proteins that regulate the stability and function of the complex. Here we wanted to see the effect of Dicer cleavage on 7SK in presence and absence of protein co-factors like TRBP and HIV-1 Gag. This might help us determine the quaternary structure of these associated proteins with the Dicer or the RNA. This, in turn, would help in understanding the mechanism of regulation of 7SK and also might give us a different understanding of the pathogenesis of HIV-1, leading to a Structure-based drug design approach in the future.

projects.title: Regulation of Dicer cleavage activity by protein factors in microRNA biogenesis pathway of humans
projects.description: MicroRNAs (miRNAs) constitute an important class of small non-coding RNAs that control gene expression at the post-transcriptional level. In humans, they play crucial roles in development and homeostasis, and altered miRNA expression profiles have been associated with numerous diseases. Although it is now well recognized that the levels of several miRNAs are regulated by protein cofactors at key steps of their maturation, the regulation mechanisms are not yet fully understood. At this time, one of the best example of a protein cofactor that regulates miRNA maturation comes from the discovery that the Lin28 and TRBP protein regulates processing of the let-7 family of miRNAs (12 members in human) through direct interactions with their immature forms, namely primary miRNAs (pri-miRNAs) and precursor miRNAs (pre-miRNAs). Although the Lin28/let-7 interaction is important in regulating mammalian development and tumorigenesis, the detailed mechanism by which Lin28 regulates miRNA maturation remains to be elucidated.

projects.title: SoeMac- a Medical Device or a Pharmaceutical product?
projects.description:
Technical intern at Regulatory Affairs division
Prepare technical and legal documents to get the medical device certification approval from the U.K. Government and M.H.R.A. The project was based on analyzing and justifying whether the device SoeMac, which produces activated oxygen is a pharmaceutical product or a medical device. The company claimed it to be a class II medical device under MHRA regulation but was rejected. So my work was to establish that fact based on the critical reference of MHRA and FDA acts on medical devices and pharmaceutical agents. This project gave me a lot of experience in regulatory affairs and we were successful at the end to a great extent.

profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Job role/Experience:
1.	Bioinformatics:
•	Modelled a novel protein to 99% accuracy based on homology
•	Developed different extensions of the protein to make it recombinantly stable 
•	Did protein-protein docking to understand its substrate interaction mechanism. This led to discovery of a new domain in the protein. 

2.	Recombinant production of proteins: 
•	Developed effective strategies for large scale enzyme free cloning
•	Produced a library of more than 20 different known and novel proteins (full length and truncations)

3.	in vitro, in cellulo and immunoassay development: 
•	Developed in vitro Fluorogenic and Fluorescence polarization/anisotropy experiments for enzyme 
        activity.
•	Good working knowledge with synthetic modified substrates and Activity based probes.
•	Fluorescent tag pulldown, Neutravidin pulldown assays
•	Developed immunoassays to monitor Interferon systems in mammalian cells
•	Experienced in functional assays to study biological function of enzymes in signaling pathways.

4.	Cell culture and CRISPR/Cas9: 
•	Hands on experience in culturing cells: Mammalian, Insect (sf9, sf21) and bacterial cells
•	Experienced in baculovirus expression systems for recombinant protein production
•	Experienced in CRISP/Cas9 gene knockout cell development.

5.	New proteomic strategy: 
•	Developed a strategy to fish out a particular post-translationally modified substrate from whole proteome.
•	Developed a tandem antibody immunoprecipitation protocol for LC-MS/MS based approach.
•	Designed a data analysis strategy in Perseus for big data sets of more than 8000-10,000 peptides
•	Did network analysis to filter out specific function of the immunoprecipitated proteins.

6.	Scientific writing and illustration: 
•	Wrote all the scientific papers in my Ph.D. targeting from medium to high impact journals.
•	Hands on experience in Adobe illustrator and photoshop package including XPpen systems for high quality scientific illustrations.
